chapters.name: Arjuna Vishada Yoga
chapters.summary: Arjuna is overwhelmed with moral doubt and sorrow on the battlefield, unwilling to fight his kin. This chapter sets the emotional stage for Krishna's teaching.

verses.sanskrit: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच | धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः | मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ||
verses.translation: Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjaya, what did my sons and the sons of Pandu do when they had assembled together, eager for battle, on the holy field of Kurukshetra?
verses.meaning: The blind king asks Sanjaya to describe the battlefield events; sets the scene for Arjuna's anguish.

chapters.name: Sankhya Yoga
chapters.summary: Krishna explains the eternal nature of the soul and introduces Karma Yoga: perform duty without attachment to outcomes.

verses.sanskrit: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन | मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि ||
verses.translation: You have the right to perform your prescribed duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits of your actions.
verses.meaning: Do your duty without attachment to results — focus on action, not on reward.

chapters.name: Karma Yoga
chapters.summary: Detailed guidance on selfless action: act according to duty with no attachment; action performed as sacrifice purifies and advances the seeker.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मादसक्ति: सततं कार्यं कर्म समाचर | असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्नोति पूरुषः ||
verses.translation: Therefore, perform your duty constantly, without attachment. By performing action without attachment one attains the Supreme.
verses.meaning: Consistent duty, done without attachment, leads to spiritual attainment.

chapters.name: Jnana Karma Sanyasa Yoga
chapters.translation: The Yoga of Knowledge, Action and Renunciation
chapters.summary: Krishna explains the relation of knowledge and action, the role of wise renunciation, and how divine knowledge is transmitted.

verses.sanskrit: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत | अभ्युत्थानमधर्मस्य तदात्मानं सृजाम्यहम् ||
verses.translation: Whenever there is a decline in righteousness and an increase of unrighteousness, O Bharata, then I manifest Myself.
verses.meaning: Divine incarnation occurs to restore dharma when it declines.

chapters.name: Karma Sanyasa Yoga
chapters.translation: The Yoga of Renunciation of Action
chapters.summary: Contrast between renunciation and renounced action; the chapter teaches that selfless action with wisdom equals true renunciation.

verses.sanskrit: ब्रह्मणो हूतं कर्म सर्वमित्यवधिक्रमः | ब्रह्मार्पणं ब्रह्म ह्मेव ब्रह्मणा हुतं ब्रह्मणा ||
verses.translation: The offerings are Brahman, the oblation is Brahman, Brahman is offered by Brahman into the fire of Brahman.
verses.meaning: When one sees the Divine in all actions and offerings, action becomes a spiritual offering.

chapters.name: Dhyana Yoga
chapters.summary: Instructions for meditation and mind control; how to establish an even-minded, steady spiritual practice leading to self-realization.

verses.sanskrit: उद्धरेदात्मनाऽत्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् | आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः ||
verses.translation: One should lift oneself by the self alone; one should not degrade oneself. The self alone is the friend of the self, and the self alone is the enemy of the self.
verses.meaning: Self-mastery is achieved by disciplined practice; the self is both helper and foe depending on discipline.

chapters.name: Jnana Vijnana Yoga
chapters.translation: The Yoga of Knowledge and Wisdom
chapters.summary: Krishna explains His immanence and transcendence — how to know God through devotion and knowledge; understanding the divine nature in the world.

verses.sanskrit: मत्तः परतरं नान्यत् किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय | मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ||
verses.translation: O Dhananjaya, there is nothing higher than Me. Everything rests in Me, as pearls are strung on a thread.
verses.meaning: All that exists is pervaded by the Divine; Krishna is the ultimate substratum of everything.

chapters.name: Akshara Brahma Yoga
chapters.translation: The Yoga of the Imperishable Absolute
chapters.summary: Teachings about the eternal (akshara), the nature of death, and how remembrance at the time of death determines one’s next state.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् | यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः ||
verses.translation: Whoever, at the end, remembers Me, and leaves the body remembering Me, attains My being — of this there is no doubt.
verses.meaning: A consciousness fixed on the Divine at death leads to union with the Divine.

chapters.name: Raja Vidya Raja Guhya Yoga
chapters.translation: The Yoga of Sovereign Knowledge and Sovereign Secret
chapters.summary: Reveals the most confidential knowledge: the intimate relationship between the Divine and the devoted soul; grace and accessibility of God to sincere devotees.

verses.sanskrit: अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते | तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम् ||
verses.translation: To those who are constantly devoted and who worship Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can come to Me. I carry what they lack and preserve what they have.
verses.meaning: God protects and guides the surrendered devotee; devotion opens the way to divine care.

chapters.name: Vibhuti Yoga
chapters.summary: Krishna describes His opulent manifestations (vibhutis) in the world — divine attributes present in creation that point back to the source.

verses.sanskrit: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते | इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमाजमुखाः ||
verses.translation: I am the origin of all; everything proceeds from Me. Those who understand this worship Me with single-minded devotion.
verses.meaning: Understanding the Divine as the source of all creation inspires devoted worship.

chapters.name: Vishvarupa Darshana Yoga
chapters.translation: The Yoga of the Vision of the Universal Form
chapters.summary: Krishna grants Arjuna divine vision to behold His universal form — an overwhelming, awe-inspiring revelation of cosmic totality and power.

verses.sanskrit: काले वारं मोहयन्तं लोकान् समार्गितुमिहैतः | श्रेयो हि अन्विच्छन्ति येऽभ्युदयाय सपत्नकाः ||
verses.translation: I am Time, the mighty destroyer of the worlds; I have come here to engage all people. With the exception of you [the Pandavas], all present here shall be slain.
verses.meaning: Krishna reveals His form as Time and the supreme force that governs the cosmic order; the vision shows inevitability of destiny.

chapters.name: Bhakti Yoga
chapters.summary: Describes devotional practices and the qualities of those dear to God — simple, loving devotion is a direct path to the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: त्रैगुण्यविषया वेदा निस्त्रैगुण्यो भव प्रद्युम्न | बाधं न कर्तव्यं विद्वान् भक्त्या यः सम्यगुपासते ||
verses.translation: The transcendentalists who are beyond the three modes of material nature, who are free from dualities, who are equipoised in both success and failure — they are very, very rare.
verses.meaning: Those who truly realize the Divine are beyond the three gunas and maintain evenness of mind; such devotion is rare.

chapters.name: Kshetra Kshetrajna Vibhaga Yoga
chapters.translation: The Yoga of Distinction Between Field and Knower of the Field
chapters.summary: Explains the difference between the body/empirical world (kshetra) and the witnessing Self (kshetrajna); introduces knowledge as liberation.

verses.sanskrit: इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते | एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहु: क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तत्र ||
verses.translation: This body, O Kaunteya, is called the field. He who knows it is called the knower of the field.
verses.meaning: Differentiating the physical body/mind from the eternal knower is fundamental to self-realization.

chapters.name: Gunatraya Vibhaga Yoga
chapters.translation: The Yoga of the Division of the Three Gunas
chapters.summary: Describes the three gunas — sattva, rajas, tamas — how they bind the soul, and how transcendence leads to liberation.

verses.sanskrit: सत्त्वानुरुपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत | श्रद्धा न्यासेऽस्मिन्प्राप्ते सिद्धिर्बहुधा भयावहा ||
verses.translation: O Bharat, for all beings the faith is in accordance with their own nature; when faith is placed in that faith, many kinds of perfection occur and fear is removed.
verses.meaning: One's faith follows their nature (guna); acting in line with sattvic faith brings steadiness and removes fear.

chapters.name: Purushottama Yoga
chapters.translation: The Yoga of the Supreme Person
chapters.summary: Metaphor of the cosmic tree and the distinction between the perishable and the imperishable; describes the supreme person (Purushottama) as the ultimate goal.

verses.sanskrit: एषा ब्राह्मिणी स्थितिः पुण्यो ब्राह्मणः परशुचिः | आत्मा सन्तोऽणिमान्त मत्येवश्च निवृत्तिः ||
verses.translation: The Supreme Person pervades all; He is both the imperishable and perishable. Realizing the Supreme beyond the cosmic tree liberates one.
verses.meaning: Transcending the temporary world and realizing the Supreme liberates the soul.

chapters.name: Daivasura Sampad Vibhaga Yoga
chapters.translation: The Yoga of the Division between Divine and Demoniac Properties
chapters.summary: Contrasts divine (daiva) and demoniac (asura) qualities and their consequences; encourages cultivating divine attributes.

verses.sanskrit: मामेवैष्यसि नान्यत्कर्तुं तस्य कर्तारमवस्थितः | जन्म कर्म च मे दिव्यानि लोके जन्मा प्रतिष्ठिताः ||
verses.translation: Those who take shelter in Me alone, thinking of no other, will know the real purpose of life; all divine births and acts return to Me.
verses.meaning: Surrender and devotion to the Divine align life with its highest purpose.

chapters.name: Sraddhatraya Vibhaga Yoga
chapters.translation: The Yoga of the Division of the Threefold Faith
chapters.summary: Explains how faith (sraddha) arises from the three gunas; outlines how beliefs and worship differ by one’s nature.

verses.sanskrit: त्रैगुण्यविषया वेदा निस्त्रैगुण्यं पुरुषोऽश्नुति | नप्तुं वावार्ड्ध्यं योगो नित्यं श्रद्दधा यः सः ||
verses.translation: The Vedas deal with the three modes of material nature; one who takes pleasure in them, bound by the three gunas, cannot reach the supreme.
verses.meaning: Faith and practice shaped by the gunas keep one bound; transcendence requires rising beyond these modes.

chapters.name: Moksha Sannyasa Yoga
chapters.translation: The Yoga of Liberation and Renunciation
chapters.summary: Final synthesis of teachings: duties, devotion, renunciation, and paths to liberation. Krishna summarizes practical guidance to achieve moksha.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज | अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः ||
verses.translation: Abandon all varieties of dharma and simply surrender unto Me alone. I will liberate you from all sinful reactions; do not fear.
verses.meaning: Complete surrender to the Divine is the highest teaching and guarantees liberation from bondage.
